description: Special Contract Rates - Service Classification No. 12
notes: This classification provides discounted rates to qualifying customers who meet eligibility criteria and execute a Customer Service Agreement. Rates are negotiated individually or based on standardized discounts related to other SC rates (SC-2D, SC-3, SC-3A, SC-4, SC-7). This tariff does not specify explicit charges but references eligibility and discount programs.

logic_steps.note: Rates for SC12 customers are based on or discounted from these standard tariff rates depending on eligibility and negotiated agreements.
Customers receiving service under SC12 are subject to a minimum bill provision, details not specified in this text.

description: Large General Service

logic_steps.step_name: Demand Charge - Minimum Demand (first 40 kW or less)

description: Large General Service - Time of Use Rate
notes: Maximum demand is the highest 15-minute demand interval during the billing period, subject to minimums based on prior months or contracted demand.
Reactive demand is the highest average lagging reactive kVA demand over 15 minutes minus one-third of the highest kW demand.
Billing period is monthly, prorated if days_used < 25 or > 35, based on days_used / 30.
Rates are subject to various surcharges and adjustments as per referenced Rules.
Customer charge varies by delivery voltage: up to 15 kV, 22-50 kV, and over 60 kV.
Demand charges vary similarly by delivery voltage.
Reactive demand charge applies to all delivery voltages.
Company supplied Electricity Supply Service Charges are separate and hourly based per Rule 46.1.

note: This service classification is canceled and contains no active rate logic.

description: Untransformed Service to Certain Customers Taking Power from Projects of the New York Power Authority

logic_steps.note: Rates applicable for Niagara Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, and SC-4 Supplemental Service are for a calendar month billing period.

The billed demand for SC-4 Supplemental Service is the greater of: (1) the amount by which the overall maximum 30-minute integrated demand exceeds the sum of demands for Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and EDP/PFJ Power; (2) the contracted SC-4 Supplemental Service demand; or (3) the minimum demand provisions of the Parent Service Classification.

The billed kWh for SC-4 Supplemental Service in each 30-minute interval is the amount by which total kWh at delivery voltage exceeds the sum of kWh from Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and EDP/PFJR Service, but not exceeding the actual total metered kWh.
Reactive Demand is the highest average RkVA of lagging reactive demand over a 30-minute interval during the month less one-third of the highest kW demand measured during the month.

SC-4 Supplemental Service customers are assigned a Parent Service Classification (SC-3A before or after Sept 1, 1998, or SC-3) which governs rates, terms, and conditions except for special provisions of SC-4.

Billed demands and energies for Niagara Power Delivery Service, Preservation Power Delivery Service, HLF Delivery Service, and Replacement Power Rate 2 are adjusted for losses between customer meter and respective switchyards as specified in Rule 39.18.
Customer charge and specific rate charges are governed by the applicable Parent Service Classification assigned to the customer.

reference: SC4 rates depend on the Parent Service Classification (SC-3A or SC-3) assigned to the customer for supplemental service. The actual rate charges (customer, energy, demand) are those of the Parent Service Classification.

description: Combined 25 and 60 Hertz Service
note: Service Classification No. 5 is canceled. No active tariff logic available.

description: Purchase of Electric Energy and Capacity from Customers with Qualifying On-Site Generation Facilities

logic_steps.notes: Real Time LBMP in $/MWh for each generator bus or nearest electrical generator bus or Load Zone Real Time LBMP if bus price unavailable. Incurred Cost includes NYISO penalties.
Capacity is Unforced Capacity recognized by NYISO for the month, capped at 5000 kW for contracts executed on or after July 1, 2019.
Rate to be paid shall be no less than 6.0 cents per kWh, averaged annually and trued-up monthly.
For qualifying small random suppliers without interval metering; customer pays installed cost of metering equipment instead of other charges.

logic_steps.step_name: Customer Charge and Buyback Contract Demand Charge
logic_steps.reference: Customer Charge and Demand Charge are based on customer's otherwise applicable service classification for delivery service. If service is taken under both SC6 and another classification through same connection, Customer Charge waived under SC6 and Demand Charge applies only to demand in excess of that billed under other classification.
logic_steps.notes: Charges vary by underlying service classification (e.g., SC1, SC2ND, SC2D, SC3 Secondary, etc.) as per table.
Buyback Contract Demand is customer's contract demand or higher maximum demand recorded, subject to restrictions on reductions and penalties for exceeding contract demand.

logic_steps.reference: Customer receives direct payment from NYISO for Reactive Supply, Regulation, Operating Reserve, and Black Start services subject to NYISO requirements and contracts.
